channel.title: What do you think?
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I am working on a mini-game I thought of, it consists of the following:
All of the Barrows Brother, 3 are randomly selected and placed into a multi-way combat area with you; you must defeat them by yourself. They drop Barrows, Ashes, Coins, Runes, and other items. It is often they you will get Karil's and Ahrims to increase the difficulty so you can't pray against all 3.
I am planning on release this once it is finished.
Video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1XDclxUu09Y&feature=youtu.be
Any suggestions?
Edit:
Changed the mini-game.
Changelog: Changed it from teleporting you away to a wave based minigame. Added points used to buy Barrows items from a shop. Added wave counter to show off your highest wave. Removed their drops.

item.title: What do you think?
item.dc:creator: @MacaYork MacaYork
item.description:
@MacaYork wrote:

Barrows can be to easy to tank, maybe instead of barrows how about godwars minions (excluding the main ones i.e graa’dor etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: What do you think?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Loveandpower:

I try not to do that it seems to irritate players when it gets too high not sure why. not to mention it then makes them really weak against ruby bolts

Bloiasuiodhqiuhqwdh

Stop outsmarting me

item.title: What do you think?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:453817”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=556658.msg4074712#msg4074712 date=1344699887]

personally I have always found barrows on rsps to be too easy, instead of only three make all five/six of them attack you. It’s sort of like during the rotm quest on runescape then.

I have tried to make it harder by giving the barrows brother veng, and actually giving them their correct armor abilities.
[/quote]I tried to make it so my barrows would have food so it made it more of a challenge but people always find a way around it :s[/quote]

Here is my dharok commenceSession() method for his combat action

@Override public boolean commenceSession() { if ((System.currentTimeMillis() - (Long) dharok.getAttribute("vengDelay", 0L) < 30000)) { //Do nothing } else { dharok.setAttribute("vengDelay", System.currentTimeMillis()); dharok.setAttribute("vengeance", Boolean.TRUE); dharok.animate(Animation.create(4410)); dharok.graphics(Graphic.create(726, 100 << 16)); } if (dharok.getHitPoints() < 400 && dharok.getRandom().nextInt(3) == 1 && dharok.getFood() > 7) { dharok.animate(829); dharok.heal(230); dharok.setFood(dharok.getFood() - 1); return false; } dharok.getCombatExecutor().setTicks(6); int hit = MeleeFormulae.getDamage(dharok, interaction.getVictim()) + Misc.random(dharok.getMaxHp() - dharok.getHitPoints()); int ticks = 1; dharok.animate(dharok.getAttackAnimation()); interaction.setDamage(Damage.getDamage(dharok, interaction.getVictim(), type, hit)); interaction.getDamage().setMaximum(680); interaction.setTicks(ticks); return true; }

Just an idea… doubting it’s even close to what you guys use for npcs

Read full topic
